natural solution: If we remember that $.\overline{1}=\frac{1}{9}$, then we know $.\overline{7}=\frac{7}{9}$ and $.\overline{8}=\frac{8}{9}$.

theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "x = sum (\<lambda>n. 7 / 10 ^ (n+1)) {n. True}"

shows  "x / y = 7 / 8"

(* ### Problem
